channel.title: projects on hrmn.dev
channel.description: Recent content in projects on hrmn.dev

item.title: ThrSqr
item.author: marc@hrmn.dev (Marc Hermann)
item.description: What started as a quick Node.js/Express exercise turned into a useful web application that can help signifcantly reduce “Who’s coming?!” message group chatter. Stay tuned for programming notes.

item.title: Microscopic Space
item.author: marc@hrmn.dev (Marc Hermann)
item.description: The task: fly through a vast network of neuron 3D models and visualize the propagation of “signals” across the network. My solution: generate the network procedurally, and the rest will follow. Stay tuned for programming notes.

item.title: Conslog
item.author: marc@hrmn.dev (Marc Hermann)
item.description: Did you know that JavaScript learners spend more than 50 percent of their time surrounding code challenge test cases with console.log()? I was one of them. Until I created Conslog, a little VS Code snippet extension to make my life (and yours?) easier.

item.title: Berlin Defendr
item.author: marc@hrmn.dev (Marc Hermann)
item.description: The problem set 0 of Harvard’s CS50x 2020 edition was to create a small application using MIT’s graphical programming interface Scratch. I decided to make this tiny (tiny!) game.
